00007 // String Table Sections
00008 //
00009 //    SgAsmPEStringTable is derived from SgAsmPESection, which is derived in turn from SgAsmGenericSection. A PE String Table
00010 //    Section points to a COFF String Table (SgAsmCoffStrtab) that is contained in the section.
00012 
00013 /* Constructor */
00014 void
00015 SgAsmPEStringSection::ctor()
00016 {
00017     get_name()->set_string("PE String Table");
00018     p_strtab = new SgAsmCoffStrtab(this);
00019 }
00020 
00021 SgAsmPEStringSection*
00022 SgAsmPEStringSection::parse()
00023 {
00024     SgAsmPESection::parse();
00025     ROSE_ASSERT(p_strtab);
00026     p_strtab->parse();
00027     return this;
00028 }
00029 
00030 /* Reallocate space for the string table if necessary. Note that reallocation is lazy here -- we don't shrink the section,
00031  * we only enlarge it (if you want the section to shrink then call SgAsmGenericStrtab::reallocate(bool) with a true value
00032  * rather than calling this function. SgAsmPEStringSection::reallocate is called in response to unparsing a file and gives
00033  * the string table a chance to extend its container section if it needs to allocate more space for strings. */
00034 bool
00035 SgAsmPEStringSection::reallocate()
00036 {
00037     return get_strtab()->reallocate(false);
00038 }
00039 
00040 /* Unparse an ElfStringSection by unparsing the ElfStrtab */
00041 void
00042 SgAsmPEStringSection::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00043 {
00044     get_strtab()->unparse(f);
00045     unparse_holes(f);
00046 }
00047 
00048 /* Augments superclass to make sure free list and such are adjusted properly */
00049 void
00050 SgAsmPEStringSection::set_size(rose_addr_t newsize)
00051 {
00052     rose_addr_t orig_size = get_size();
00053     SgAsmPESection::set_size(newsize);
00054     SgAsmGenericStrtab *strtab = get_strtab();
00055 
00056     if (get_size() > orig_size) {
00057         /* Add new address space to string table free list */
00058         rose_addr_t n = get_size() - orig_size;
00059         strtab->get_freelist().insert(Extent(orig_size, n));
00060     } else if (get_size() < orig_size) {
00061         /* Remove deleted address space from string table free list */
00062         rose_addr_t n = orig_size - get_size();
00063         strtab->get_freelist().erase(Extent(get_size(), n));
00064     }
00065 }
00066 
00067 /* Print some debugging info */
00068 void
00069 SgAsmPEStringSection::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00070 {
00071     char p[4096];
00072     if (idx>=0) {
00073         sprintf(p, "%sPEStringSection[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00074     } else {
00075         sprintf(p, "%sPEStringSection.", prefix);
00076     }
00077     
00078     SgAsmPESection::dump(f, p, -1);
00079 
00080     ROSE_ASSERT(get_strtab()!=NULL);
00081     get_strtab()->dump(f, p, -1);
00082 
00083     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmPEStringSection) //unless a base class
00084         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00085 }
00086 
00088 // String Tables
00089 //
00090 //    An SgAsmCoffStrtab is a COFF String Table, inheriting from SgAsmGenericStrtab. String tables point to the
00091 //    SgAsmGenericSection that contains them.
00093 
00094 /* Free StringStorage objects associated with this string table. It may not be safe to blow them away yet since other objects
00095  * may still have SgAsmStoredStrings pointing to these storage objects. So instead, we will mark all this strtab's storage
00096  * objects as no longer being associated with a string table. This allows the SgAsmStoredString objects to still function
00097  * properly and their destructors (~SgAsmStoredString) will free their storage. */
00098 SgAsmCoffStrtab::~SgAsmCoffStrtab()
00099 {
00100     for (referenced_t::iterator i = p_storage_list.begin(); i != p_storage_list.end(); ++i) {
00101         SgAsmStringStorage *storage = *i;
00102         storage->set_strtab(NULL);
00103         storage->set_offset(SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00104     }
00105     p_storage_list.clear();
00106     p_dont_free = NULL; /*FIXME: can't delete for same reason as in SgAsmStoredString destructor. (RPM 2008-09-05) */
00107 }
00108 
00109 /* Creates the storage item for the string at the specified offset. If "shared" is true then attempt to re-use a previous storage
00110  * object, otherwise create a new one. Each storage object is considered to be a separate string, therefore when two strings
00111  * share the same storage object, changing one string changes the other. */
00112 SgAsmStringStorage *
00113 SgAsmCoffStrtab::create_storage(rose_addr_t offset, bool shared)
00114 {
00115     ROSE_ASSERT(offset!=SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00116     SgAsmGenericSection *container = get_container();
00117 
00118     /* Has the string already been created? */
00119     if (shared) {
00120         for (referenced_t::iterator i=p_storage_list.begin(); i!=p_storage_list.end(); ++i) {
00121             if ((*i)->get_offset()==offset && (*i)!=p_dont_free)
00122                 return *i;
00123         }
00124     }
00125 
00126     /* Read string length byte */
00127     unsigned char byte;
00128     container->read_content_local(offset, &byte, 1);
00129     unsigned len = byte;
00130 
00131     /* Make sure new storage isn't inside some other string. (We don't support nested strings in COFF where the length byte of
00132      * the nested string is one of the characters of the outer string.) */
00133     for (referenced_t::iterator i=p_storage_list.begin(); i!=p_storage_list.end(); ++i) {
00134         ROSE_ASSERT((*i)->get_offset()==SgAsmGenericString::unallocated ||
00135                     offset + 1 + len <= (*i)->get_offset() ||
00136                     offset >= 1 + (*i)->get_string().size());
00137     }
00138 
00139     /* Create storage object */
00140     char *buf = new char[len];
00141     container->read_content_local(offset+1, buf, len);
00142     SgAsmStringStorage *storage = new SgAsmStringStorage(this, std::string(buf, len), offset);
00143     delete[] buf;
00144 
00145     /* It's a bad idea to free (e.g., modify) strings before we've identified all the strings in the table. Consider
00146      * the case where two strings have the same value and point to the same offset (i.e., they share storage). If we modify one
00147      * before we know about the other then (at best) we modify the other one also.
00148      * 
00149      * The only time we can guarantee this is OK is when the new storage points to the same file location as "dont_free"
00150      * since the latter is guaranteed to never be freed or shared. This exception is used when creating a new, unallocated
00151      * string (see SgAsmStoredString(SgAsmGenericStrtab,const std::string&)). */
00152     if (p_num_freed>0 && (!p_dont_free || offset!=p_dont_free->get_offset())) {
00153         fprintf(stderr,
00154                 "SgAsmCoffStrtab::create_storage(%"PRIu64"): %zu other string%s (of %zu created) in [%d] \"%s\""
00155                 " %s been modified and/or reallocated!\n",
00156                 offset, p_num_freed, 1==p_num_freed?"":"s", p_storage_list.size(),
00157                 container->get_id(), container->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str(),
00158                 1==p_num_freed?"has":"have");
00159         ROSE_ASSERT(0==p_num_freed);
00160     }
00161 
00162     set_isModified(true);
00163     p_storage_list.push_back(storage);
00164     return storage;
00165 }
00166 
00167 /* Returns the number of bytes required to store the string in the string table. This is one (the length byte) plus the
00168  * length of the string. */
00169 rose_addr_t
00170 SgAsmCoffStrtab::get_storage_size(const SgAsmStringStorage *storage) {
00171     return 1 + storage->get_string().size();
00172 }
00173 
00174 /* Write string table back to disk. Free space is zeroed out; holes are left as they are. */
00175 void
00176 SgAsmCoffStrtab::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00177 {
00178     SgAsmGenericSection *container = get_container();
00179 
00180     /* Write length coded strings. Shared strings will be written more than once, but that's OK. */
00181     for (size_t i=0; i<p_storage_list.size(); i++) {
00182         SgAsmStringStorage *storage = p_storage_list[i];
00183         ROSE_ASSERT(storage->get_offset()!=SgAsmGenericString::unallocated);
00184         rose_addr_t at = container->write(f, storage->get_offset(), storage->get_string());
00185         container->write(f, at, '\0');
00186     }
00187     
00188     /* Fill free areas with zero */
00189     for (ExtentMap::const_iterator i=get_freelist().begin(); i!=get_freelist().end(); ++i) {
00190         container->write(f, i->first.first(), std::string(i->first.size(), '\0'));
00191     }
00192 }
